Detailed Description

template<unsigned D>
class vertex_data< D >

Base class for all Rotope s. This class may vanish, as Object can take its place.

Contains an array of vertices (Vectors) and a function to print them. This is used mainly in the development of Rotope objects.

Parameters:
D Dimension of the vector space we're working in
Author:
Helge Preuss <scout@hyperspace-travel.de>

template<unsigned D>
bool vertex_data< D >::checkSurfaceExists ( const uintvec1D &  newSurface  )  [inline, private]

Returns:
Whether argument or permutation of it already in _surface
Test if a new surface is a permutation of a surface already existing.
Parameters:
newSurface The surface to be tested whether it is already stored

Check for equality against every surface in _surface .

Because the corners of a surface are all different numbers, if we found an equal vertex for each corner, the surface is considered equal.

That algorithm breaks down if there are surfaces which are odd permutations of existing surfaces, eg. (0, 1, 3, 2), (0, 1, 2, 3). I don't think such permutations make sense, as the edges of the surface would be self-intersecting.

References std::vector< _Tp, _Alloc >::size(), and vertex_data< D >::surface().

Referenced by vertex_data< D >::addSurface().
